While diplomacy and disarmament efforts are undoubtedly valuable, the presence of a controlled arsenal of weapons of mass destruction can serve as a necessary deterrent against potential aggressors. The credible threat of retaliation with such weapons can dissuade adversaries from initiating conflicts or attacks. It acts as a form of insurance, ensuring the protection of national security interests. In an unpredictable world, having this deterrent can help maintain stability and prevent adversaries from taking undue risks.
